dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6540 IH: Tigertail Historical Tree Island Repatriation Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Wasserman Schultz (for herself and Ms. Salazar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To realign L–29 at full Federal expense for the Miccosukee Tribe to expand the area for the Tigertail camp, which is a residential area.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tigertail Historical Tree Island Repatriation Act of 2023.

section.header: Central and Southern Florida Project, modification of the L-29 levee
section.text: In consultation with the South Florida Water Management District, the Secretary of the Army is authorized to design and construct, at full Federal expense, modifications to the L–29 Levee component of the Central and Southern Florida Project, to realign a portion of the L–29 Section 3 Levee Segment to reconfigure the levee in the vicinity of the Miccosukee Tribe of Indians of Florida’s Tigertail Camp, as expanded pursuant to the Miccosukee Tribe of Indians of Florida’s lease from the South Florida Water Management District. Any necessary lands, easements, rights-of-way, relocations, and dredge disposal areas (LERRDs) for such a modification would be provided by the South Florida Water Management District.
